intro: Meibomia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered meibomia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers and opposite, elliptical leaves. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Meibomia parviflora is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
